title: Fire rains down from the sky as Israel launches missile attack on Gaza
message:
Fire rains down from the sky during Israel's latest missile attack on Gaza as the Middle Eastern conflict shows no signs of ending.
Photographs taken today show smoke and flames engulfing buildings in the Al Bureij Camp in Deir al-Balah — a city in the central Gaza strip.
It comes after Israel's military confirmed the deaths of four more hostages held in Gaza since the October 7 attack on a music festival.
'Under the proposal, Israel will continue to insist these conditions are met before a permanent ceasefire is put in place.
The notion that Israel will agree to a permanent ceasefire before these conditions are fulfilled is a non-starter.'

title: US to Buy Norwegian Joint Strike Missile for its F - 35A Stealth Aircraft
message:
F-35A Expands Strike Capabilities with New JSM (Joint Strike Missile) Contract.
“The Joint Strike Missile (JSM) is an air-launched strike missile and is designed to fit into the internal weapons bay and to fulfil complex missions, such as ASuW (Anti-Surface Warfare) and land attack.
The JSM is the air-launched version of Kongsberh’s NSM (Naval Strike Missile).
The F-35 cannot carry large missiles like the AGM-158C LRASM (Long-Range Anti-Ship Missile) and the AGM-158A JASSM (Joint Air-to-Surface Standoff Missile) inside its internal weapons bay in the underbelly.
Consistent with F-35’s ‘Strike Orientation’Like the ship-borne NSM, the JSM too can be used against both ship and land-targets, making it versatile and allowing commanders significant tactical flexibility.

title: The atomic club
message:
Within two weeks of these nuclear tests, Pakistan followed suit by demonstrating its own nuclear capability on May 18, 1998.
India’s aggressive pursuit of its nuclear capability leads us to one conclusion: the international community, throughout history, has largely turned a blind eye towards India’s nuclear developments.
In fact, the global nuclear powers, particularly the US, failed to implement stringent measures against India’s nuclear weapons programme.
Pakistan was indeed a reluctant entrant to the nuclear club.
Despite the potential for heightened tensions following the launch of the missile by India, Pakistan chose to approach the situation with measured calmness.

title: 2 Hezbollah fighters die in Lebanon - Newspaper
message:
BEIRUT: Hezbollah said two of its fighters were killed by Israeli fire on Monday, after Lebanese official media reported fatalities in Israeli strikes on a car and a motorcycle in the country’s south.
Almost eight months of regular cross-border clas­hes between the Iran-backed Hezbollah group, a Hamas ally, and Israel have intensified in recent days.
The latest violence came as Iran’s acting foreign minister Ali Bagheri was visiting Lebanon, where he was expected to meet Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah.
On Sunday, Hezbollah said its fighters had bombarded two army positions in the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights after deadly Israeli strikes on south Lebanon, which an official said killed two shepherds.
The violence since early October has killed at least 453 people in Lebanon, mostly fighters but including 88 civilians, according to a tally.

title: BBC pundit forced to apologise after posting image of Rishi Sunak , President Biden and other world leaders with Hitler moustaches that labelled them the  Kids Killers Union
message:
A BBC pundit has been forced to apologise after posting an image of Rishi Sunak, President Biden and other world leaders with Hitler moustaches.
Qasim Sheikh, a former Scotland international cricketer, reposted the picture of the prime minister, along with other world leaders with the caption 'Kids Killers Union'.
The post featured President Biden, Binyamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, Olaf Scholz, the German chancellor and Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission.
The sports pundit, 39, shared the post in January as well as other inflammatory statements appearing to justify the horrific October 7 attacks on Israel.
To make it even worse the oppressor Israel has tried to blame someone else for the bombing.'

title: Nuclear war is unimaginable – but US author wants us to try
message:
Gone in 72 minutes: Writer Anne Jacobson outlines a nuclear war scenario that sees our world destroyed in little more than one hour.
Photo / Getty ImagesBook review: Day in and day out, the American Secret Service trains its staff for nuclear war.
Nuclear war is unimaginable – but Jacobsen would like you to try.
Her minute by minute timeline of unfolding Armageddon reveals long practised US and Russian plans for nuclear war.
A nuclear war, of the kind planned for and rehearsed by the US and Russian military, will lead to the deaths of billions of people.

message: Police are still trying to track down the weapon used to kill Kye Schaefer, who was stabbed multiple times in the chest and neck during the attack on May 2.

title: Houthis claim launching missiles at Israeli port city
message:
Sanaa, June 4 : Yemen's Houthi group has said they launched a ballistic missile attack on southern Israel's port city of Eilat, the group's Military Spokesman Yahya Sarea said in a statement.
The missile forces of the Houthi group targeted on Monday a military site in Eilat with a new self-made missile called "Palestine", said the Houthi official, claiming that "the operation achieved its goal successfully", Xinhua news agency reported.
He also pledged continued military operations "in support of the Palestinian people" until Israel stops its attacks on the Palestinian enclave.
Earlier on Monday, Israeli media outlets reported that the Israeli forces in Eilat intercepted a ballistic missile coming from the direction of the Red Sea.
Several ships had been reportedly damaged by Houthi attacks.

title: Kye Schaefer breakthrough : Man is charged with murdering surfer after leaving the water in Coffs Harbour
message:
A man has been charged with murder after a young surfer was allegedly stabbed to death moments after leaving the water.
Kye Schaefer, 21, was allegedly stabbed in the neck and chest after stepping out of the surf at Park Beach on Ocean Parade in Coffs Harbour around 6.40am on May 2.
NSW Police revealed on Tuesday a 36-year-old homeless man had been arrested at a Coffs Harbour correctional facility.
The man was refused bail to appear before Coffs Harbour Local Court on Tuesday.
Kye was treated at the scene and transported to Coffs Harbour Base Hospital, but died shortly after arriving from serious neck and chest wounds.

title: Mishawaka teen charged with stabbing mom , 2 dogs ruled insane
message:
No trial for the Mishawaka teen accused of stabbing his s.The courts say 17-year-old Caden Rutledge who was being charged as an adult, is not responsible by reason of insanity.
During the investigation Rutledge claims he was manipulated by Satan to stab his mother and 2 dogs when questioned by police.
Caden Rutledge was set for trial until the courts ruled him not responsible by reason of insanity.
Back in August of 2023, Mishawaka Police found Rutledge's mother bleeding from multiple stab wounds to her face, neck and head at her neighbor's home.
Rutledge admitted stabbing his mother to "kill the demon inside of her and that it was the right thing to do."

He also pledged continued military operations "in support of the Palestinian people" until Israel stops its on the Palestinian enclave.
Earlier on Monday, Israeli media outlets reported that the Israeli forces in Eilat intercepted a ballistic missile coming from the direction of the Red Sea.

message:

message:

title: 16 killed in Israeli strike near Aleppo - Newspaper
message:
BEIRUT: A war monitoring body on Monday said that 16 members from groups’ allied with Iran, were killed in an Israeli strike near the northern Syrian city of Aleppo.
“The death toll of the Israeli strike on a factory in Hayyan, in the western Aleppo province has risen to 16 pro-Iran group members, including Syrian and foreigner fighters” stated the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.
A Syrian defence ministry statement read “after midnight, the Israeli enemy launched an air attack from the southeast of Aleppo, targeting some positions” near the city.
On Wednesday, according to the Observatory, Israeli strikes in western and central Syria killed a girl and six fighters working with Hezbollah (including three Syrians).
In March, the Observatory had said that Israeli air strikes near Aleppo’s airport had killed 52 people.

title: OC rideshare driver who shot suspect allegedly assaulting woman could face charges
message:
A man was hospitalized after being shot by a rideshare driver who allegedly witnessed the man assaulting a woman and took action to stop the attack.
It is unclear what happened next, but authorities said the rideshare driver shot the suspect.
The man assaulting the woman, only identified as a 20-year-old, sustained a gunshot wound and was taken to the hospital in critical but stable condition.
The sheriff's office said the rideshare driver remained at the scene and called dispatch to report the shooting.
He may face charges pending further investigation, the sheriff’s office said in a statement.

title: Las Vegas WWII veteran recalls his time on the USS Cavalier , 80 years since D - Day
message:
Las Vegas WWII veteran recalls his time on the USS Cavalier, 80 years since D-DayLAS VEGAS (KLAS) — As his 99th birthday approaches, a Las Vegas local looked back on his experience in the Second World War and reflected on the 80 years since the Normandy landings on D-Day in 1944.
A photo shows Herb Cohen, a Las Vegas local who served as a U.S. Coast Guardsman aboard the USS Cavalier.
Herb Cohen served aboard the USS Cavalier, an attack transport deployed to the Pacific Theater during World War II.
From the Cavalier, Cohen and his brothers-in-arms helped to fight off the Japanese army, a brutal and bloody conflict that left its mark on the young man.
Eventually, the soldier settled down, made Las Vegas his home, married, and had a family.

message:

Ukrainian ombudsman Dmytro Lubinets said the footage showed Russian soldiers "mocking Ukrainian prisoners of war".
"Unfortunately, such treatment of Ukrainian prisoners of war is not an exception to the rules, but a common tactic for the occupiers."

title: A Black medic wounded on D - Day is finally posthumously honored
message:

Members of the First Army, which included Woodson’s unit during World War II, is taking a World War II-era Distinguished Service Cross with them to France.
Woodson was just 21 years old when his unit, the 320th Barrage Balloon Battalion, took part in the Allied operation.
Although 1.2 million Black Americans served in the military during World War II, none was among the original recipients of the Medal of Honor awarded in the conflict.
Ultimately, seven Black World War II troops were awarded the Medal of Honor in 1997.

title: South Korea suspending military deal with North Korea
message:
South Korea’s government has approved the suspension of a contentious military agreement with North Korea, a step that would allow it to take tougher responses to North Korean provocations.
South Korea’s Cabinet Council passed a proposal on Tuesday aimed at suspending the 2018 inter-Korean agreement on lowering down frontline military tensions.
South Korean soldier wearing protective gears checks the trash from a balloon presumably sent by North Korea, in Incheon, South Korea (Im Sun-suk/Yonhap/AP)Mr Han cited North Korea’s balloon campaign, tests of nuclear-capable weapons targeting South Korea and alleged jamming of GPS navigation signals in the South.
In the past week, North Korea used balloons to drop manure, cigarette butts, scraps of cloth and waste paper on South Korea, who vowed unspecified “unbearable” retaliatory steps.
South Korean officials said the suspension of the 2018 deal would allow it to stage frontline military drills but didn’t publicly elaborate on other steps.

message:

title: Delhi Minister Saurabh Bharadwaj conducts surprise inspection of  Rain basera
message:
To ensure adequate arrangements at 'Rain baseras' during the ongoing heat wave, Delhi's Urban Development Minister Saurabh Bharadwaj on Monday afternoon conducted a surprise inspection of several night shelters in Delhi, an official statement said.
Saurabh Bharadwaj, who is Vice Chairman of the Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board (DUSIB) took stock of the arrangements made at the night shelters.
Issuing a statement, Minister Bharadwaj said, "he saw adequate arrangements for water dispensers to provide cold drinking water to the people and water air coolers for cold air."
"Arrangements must be made immediately wherevr any deficiency is found in the water arrangement or supply of cold water.
And, wherever a problem with the air cooler is noticed, that problem should be resolved immediately," he said.

title: Bagpipes , flags welcome Chicago - area WWII veterans heading back to France for D - Day anniversary
message:
There were bagpipes, flags, and a grand procession at O'Hare Airport's Terminal 1 as three World War II veterans headed back to France on Monday.
"Many of us here could not even fathom the sacrifices and contributions you made to our country," said Omar Idris of United Airlines.
"You realize how bad it was when you walk the cemeteries in France," Malin said.
The three men and their families were cheered all the way to the gate as the event was coordinated by United Airlines and its United for Veterans Group.
Even more special, the entire flight crew to France was made up of veterans.

title: The Eastern Front : A History of the First World War by Nick Lloyd : A compelling and authoritative read
message:
Photograph: Oesterreichsches Volkshochschularchiv/Imagno/Getty ImagesThe Eastern Front: A History of the First World War Author : Nick Lloyd ISBN-13 : 978-0241506851 Publisher : Viking Guideline Price : £30The first World War started with the assassination 110 years ago of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo, yet the Eastern Front is little known or understood in the West.
READ MOREThe three main protagonists, Germany, the Austro-Hungarian empire and Russian empire, were defeated.
The Russian empire, as has been exhaustively chronicled elsewhere, withdrew from the war to preserve the nascent Bolshevik revolution.
Italy lost 500,000 men in the first World War and got nothing like the territories it had anticipated despite being on the winning side.
It was out of the chaos of the first World War that the first Ukrainian state was declared in January 1918.

title: CS Runn Announces His Military Thriller The Moral Conundrum
message:
(MENAFN- BookBuzz) CS Runn announces the promotion of his riveting action thriller, The Moral Conundrum.
In The Moral Conundrum, readers are introduced to Reed Stanton, a navy fighter pilot and devoted family man.
Author CS Runn brings a wealth of personal experience to The Moral Conundrum, drawing on his background as a navy veteran and former employee of the Federal Aviation Administration.
Experience the adrenaline rush of The Moral Conundrum today!
A passionate explorer of America's national parks, CS Runn currently resides in San Diego, California.

title: Fostering Tri - Service Collaboration At Grassroot Level : 40 Trainee Officers Commence Joint Training At DSSC
message:
For the first time, a select number of officers are being trained under the newly established joint training team at the Defence Services Staff College (DSSC).
Sources in the defence and security establishment said:“About 40 trainee officers are under the newly appointed head of the Joint Training team."
Recently, a Brigadier-level Joint Training Officer was appointed to lead the new joint training team.
"As the tri-services posting has already begun, this step is aimed at taking the joint training to the grassroots level,” sources added.
"Over the years joint training capsules at DSSC have been increasing to reach the level of above 70 percent now,” sources said.

title: 2 Japanese F - 35 fighter jets make emergency landings after 1 has a mechanical problem | News , Sports , Jobs
message:
TOKYO (AP) — Two Japanese F-35A stealth fighter jets made emergency landings at a commercial airport in northern Japan on Monday, but there were no injuries or damage, officials said.
The fighter jets were on a training flight from Misawa Air Base and landed safely at nearby Aomori Airport after one developed an unspecified mechanical problem and requested an emergency landing, airport officials said.
Japan’s Air Self Defense Force declined to provide details, including the cause of the emergency landing.
The airport said its runway was closed for about 20 minutes because of the emergency landing before operations returned to normal.
The incident is the latest in a series of problems involving flight training by Japan’s military.

title: John Nelson : Purple Heart recipient reflects on days in Vietnam
message:
In all, Nelson logged 2,600 hours of combat flight during his two years in Vietnam.
The Air Force also recognized Nelson with five additional Air Medals for his service.
But Nelson doesn’t like to talk much about his experience or awards from his war days.
After graduating from the University of Montana and marrying his high school sweetheart, Caryl Ann Burgess, Nelson entered the U.S. Air Force.
After completing his tour of Vietnam, Nelson was stationed in Texas at Laredo AFB for two years, where he taught new pilots.

title: In the New Cold War , Europe Approach to China Is Already Outdated – The Diplomat
message:
In the new Cold War, Russia is more important to the Chinese leadership than Europe.
In the new Cold War, Eastern Europe and the Indo-Pacific are part of a united Eurasian strategic theater.
Geographically, just like the 20th-century Cold War, the new one reflects the expansive logic of malleable buffer zones.
It appears that both Moscow and Beijing are ready for the turbulence of the new Cold War.
The most pressing issue along the two geographical fault lines in the coming years is keeping the new Cold War “cold” and preventing it from becoming a full-blown global hot war.

title: Today in History : June 4 , World War II Battle of Midway begins in the Pacific
message:
Today's Highlight in History:On June 4, 1942, the World War II Battle of Midway began, resulting in a decisive American victory against Japan and marking the turning point of the war in the Pacific.
In 1940, during World War II, the Allied military evacuation of some 338,000 troops from Dunkirk, France, ended.
British Prime Minister Winston Churchill declared: ''We shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds, we shall fight in the fields and in the streets, we shall fight in the hills; we shall never surrender.''
Rock musician JoJo Garza (Los Lonely Boys) is 44.
Rock musician Zac Farro is 34.

title: World Environment Day : How smart and sustainable cities can transform our ecosystems
message:
The World Environment Day 2024 offers a window of opportunity and action at a time when nearly one-fifth of earth’s land is damaged, forests are disappearing, water bodies are shrinking, and farms are turning into dust bowls.
Embracing sustainable developmentIndeed, GCC states have emerged as true global leaders in the fight against climate change and embracing sustainable development.
The World Environment Day hosted by the region is the perfect occasion to reflect why the cities of the future must be sustainable and smart, and help preserve our precious natural resources for future generations, through collaborative work between the private and public sectors.
As demonstrated by pioneering sustainable projects in the UAE, such as Sharjah Sustainable City, cities that offer an eco-friendly lifestyle and pave the way for a net-zero future are already here.
That’s why there’s no better time than this World Environment Day to turn those ambitions and commitments into a turning point for environmental action for a transformative future.
